com.persistit

Class BufferPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.persistit.BufferPool

  • public class BufferPool
extends Object
    A pool of Buffer objects, maintained on various lists that permit rapid lookup and replacement of pages images within Buffers.
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    peter

    • Method Detail

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Returns:
        Size (in bytes) of each Buffer managed by this pool.

      • getBufferCount

        public int getBufferCount()
        Returns:
        The count of Buffers managed by this pool.

      • getMissCounter

        public long getMissCounter()
        Returns:
        The count of lookup operations for pages images in this pool that required a physical read operation. This number, in comparison with the hit counter, indicates how effective the cache is in reducing disk I/O.

      • getHitCounter

        public long getHitCounter()
        Returns:
        The count of lookup operations for pages images in this pool for which the page image was already found in this BufferPool. This number, in comparison with the get counter, indicates how effective the cache is in reducing disk I/O.

      • getNewCounter

        public long getNewCounter()
        Returns:
        The count of buffers newly created in this pool. Each time a new page is added to a Volume, this counter is incremented.

      • getForcedWriteCounter

        public long getForcedWriteCounter()
        This counter is incremented ach time the eviction algorithm selects a dirty buffer to evict. Normally dirty pages are written by the background PAGE_WRITER thread, and therefore an abnormally large forcedWrite count indicates the PAGE_WRITER thread is falling behind.
        Returns:
        The count of buffers written to disk when evicted.

      • getForcedCheckpointWriteCounter

        public long getForcedCheckpointWriteCounter()
        This counter is incremented each time a application modifies a buffer that is (a) dirty, and (b) required to be written as part of a checkpoint. An abnormally large count indicates that the PAGE_WRITER thread is falling behind.
        Returns:
        The count of buffers written to disk due to a checkpoint.

      • resetCounters

        public void resetCounters()
        Resets the get and hit counters to zero.

      • getHitRatio

        public double getHitRatio()
        Get the "hit ratio" - the number of hits divided by the number of overall gets. A value close to 1.0 indicates that most attempts to find data in the BufferPool are successful - i.e., that the cache is effectively reducing the need for disk read operations.
        Returns:
        The ratio

      • getBufferCopy

        public Buffer getBufferCopy(Volume vol,
                   long page)
                     throws InvalidPageAddressException,
                            InvalidPageStructureException,
                            VolumeClosedException,
                            InUseException,
                            PersistitIOException,
                            PersistitInterruptedException
        Returns a copy of Buffer. The returned buffer is newly created, is not a member of the buffer pool, and is not claimed. There is no guarantee that the content of this copy is internally consistent because another thread may be modifying the buffer while the copy is being made. The returned Buffer should be used only for display and diagnostic purposes.
        Parameters:
        vol -
        page -
        Returns:
        Copy of the Buffer
        Throws:
        InvalidPageAddressException
        InvalidPageStructureException
        VolumeClosedException
        PersistitInterruptedException
        RetryException
        IOException
        InUseException
        PersistitIOException

      • getBufferCopy

        public Buffer getBufferCopy(int index)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getEarliestDirtyTimestamp

        public long getEarliestDirtyTimestamp()
        Returns:
        Earliest timestamp of any dirty page in this BufferPool.
